abstract: Monday was a big deal for dealmaking. It may have been an even bigger day for Citigroup. Citi’s investment bank had a role in all the big headline deals of the day — more than $80 billion worth — which propelled it into first place, ahead of Goldman Sachs, in the worldwide merger advisory league tables compiled by Thomson Financial. Among the recent deals in which Citi had a hand were Alltel‘s $27.5 billion sale to TPG and Goldman Sachs; General Electric‘s sale of its plastics division to Saudi Basic Industries for $11.6 billion; EMI‘s 3.5 billion pound sale to Terra Firma; UniCredit‘s $29 billion acquisition of Capitalia; Banca Popolare di Milano‘s purchase of Banca Popolare dell’Emilia Romagna for $7.6 billion.
